metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: JavaScript Let
The let keyword was introduced in ES6 (2015)
content.html: The let keyword was introduced in ES6 (2015)

content.text: Variables declared with let have Block Scope
content.html: Variables declared with let have Block Scope

content.text: Variables declared with let must be Declared before use
content.html: Variables declared with let must be Declared before use

content.text: Variables declared with let cannot be Redeclared in the same scope
content.html: Variables declared with let cannot be Redeclared in the same scope

content.text: Block Scope
Before ES6 (2015), JavaScript did not have Block Scope .
content.html: Before ES6 (2015), JavaScript did not have Block Scope.

content.text: JavaScript had Global Scope and Function Scope .
content.html: JavaScript had Global Scope and Function Scope.

content.text: ES6 introduced the two new JavaScript keywords: let and const .
content.html: ES6 introduced the two new JavaScript keywords: let and const.

content.text: These two keywords provided Block Scope in JavaScript:
content.html: These two keywords provided Block Scope in JavaScript:

syntaxHighlighting.text: // x can NOT be used here

syntax_highlighting.text: // x can NOT be used here

content.code_html:
{
  let x = 2;
}
// x can NOT be used here

syntax_highlighting_data.text: // x can NOT be used here

content.text: Global Scope
Variables declared with the var always have Global Scope .
content.html: Variables declared with the var always have Global Scope.

content.text: Variables declared with the var keyword can NOT have block scope:
content.html: Variables declared with the var keyword can NOT have block scope:

content.code_html:
{
  var x = 2;
}
// x CAN be used here

content.text: Cannot be Redeclared
Variables defined with let can not be redeclared.
content.html: Variables defined with let can not be redeclared.

content.text: You can not accidentally redeclare a variable declared with let .
content.html: You can not accidentally redeclare a variable declared with let.

content.code_html:
let x = "John Doe";

let x = 0;

content.text: Variables defined with var can be redeclared.
content.html: Variables defined with var can be redeclared.

content.code_html:
var x = "John Doe";

var x = 0;

content.text: Redeclaring Variables
Redeclaring a variable using the var keyword can impose problems.
content.html: Redeclaring a variable using the var keyword can impose problems.

content.text: Redeclaring a variable inside a block will also redeclare the variable outside the block:
content.html: Redeclaring a variable inside a block will also redeclare the variable outside the block:

content.code_html:
var x = 10;
// Here x is 10
{
var x = 2;
// Here x is 2
}

// Here x is 2

content.text: Redeclaring a variable using the let keyword can solve this problem.
content.html: Redeclaring a variable using the let keyword can solve this problem.

content.text: Redeclaring a variable inside a block will not redeclare the variable outside the block:
content.html: Redeclaring a variable inside a block will not redeclare the variable outside the block:

content.code_html:
let x = 10;
// Here x is 10
{
let x = 2;
// Here x is 2
}

// Here x is 10

content.text: Difference Between var, let and const
What is Good?
let and const have block scope .
content.html: let and const have block scope.

content.text: let and const can not be redeclared .
content.html: let and const can not be redeclared.

content.text: let and const must be declared before use.
content.html: let and const must be declared before use.

content.text: let and const does not bind to this .
content.html: let and const does not bind to this.

content.text: let and const are not hoisted .
content.html: let and const are not hoisted.

content.text: What is Not Good?
var does not have to be declared.
content.html: var does not have to be declared.

content.text: var is hoisted.
content.html: var is hoisted.

content.text: var binds to this.
content.html: var binds to this.

content.text: Browser Support
The let and const keywords are not supported in Internet Explorer 11 or earlier.
content.html: The let and const keywords are not supported in Internet Explorer 11 or earlier.

content.text: The following table defines the first browser versions with full support:
content.html: The following table defines the first browser versions with full support:

content.code_html:
Chrome 49 Edge 12 Firefox 36 Safari 11 Opera 36
Mar, 2016 Jul, 2015 Jan, 2015 Sep, 2017 Mar, 2016

content.text: Redeclaring
Redeclaring a JavaScript variable with var is allowed anywhere in a program:
content.html: Redeclaring a JavaScript variable with var is allowed anywhere in a program:

content.code_html:
var x = 2;
// Now x is 2
var x = 3;
// Now x is 3

content.text: With let , redeclaring a variable in the same block is NOT allowed:
content.html: With let, redeclaring a variable in the same block is NOT allowed:

content.code_html:
var x = 2;   // Allowed
 let x = 3;   // Not allowed
{
let x = 2;   // Allowed
 let x = 3;   // Not allowed
 }

{
let x = 2;   // Allowed
 var x = 3;   // Not allowed
 }

content.text: Redeclaring a variable with let , in another block, IS allowed:
content.html: Redeclaring a variable with let, in another block, IS allowed:

content.code_html:
let x = 2;   // Allowed

{
let x = 3;   // Allowed
 }

{
let x = 4;    // Allowed
 }

content.text: Let Hoisting
Variables defined with var are hoisted to the top and can be initialized at any time.
content.html: Variables defined with var are hoisted to the top and can be initialized at any time.

content.text: Meaning: You can use the variable before it is declared:
content.html: Meaning: You can use the variable before it is declared:

content.code_html:
carName = "Volvo";
var carName;

content.text: If you want to learn more about hoisting, study the chapter JavaScript Hoisting .
content.html: If you want to learn more about hoisting, study the chapter JavaScript Hoisting.

content.text: Variables defined with let are also hoisted to the top of the block, but not initialized.
content.html: Variables defined with let are also hoisted to the top of the block, but not initialized.

content.text: Meaning: Using a let variable before it is declared will result in a ReferenceError :
content.html: Meaning: Using a let variable before it is declared will result in a ReferenceError:

content.code_html:
carName = "Saab";
let carName = "Volvo";

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is a correct use of the let keyword?
content.html: What is a correct use of the let keyword?
